<<<<<<< HEAD
Olbia, the new i[s]land lately discovered with its religion and rites of worship, laws, customs, and government, characters and language : with education of their children in their sciences, arts and manufactures with other things remarkable / by a Christian pilgrim, driven by tempest from Civita Vecchia, or some other parts about Rome, through the straits, into the Atlantick Ocean ; the first part, from the original. Sadler, John, 1615-1674.
[16], 380 [i.e. 376] p.
For Samuel Hartlib ... and John Bartlet ..., [S.l.] : 1660.
Written by J. Sadler. Cf. Halkett & Laing (2nd ed.). No more published. Reproduction of original in Yale University Library.
=======
